turns.speaker: DRAKE
turns.text: Shoot him in the head. Always shoot a Jew in the head.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I'm a bad shot. I don't think I can --

turns.speaker: DRAKE
turns.text: Just get him in the cross-hairs. With those shells, anywhere you hit him, it'll bounce around, rip his insides all up.

turns.speaker: DRAKE
turns.text: You missed on purpose.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I didn't. I told you, I can't --

turns.speaker: DRAKE
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: And what did you do?

turns.speaker: HATE COUNSELOR
turns.text: What are you trying to say?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What did you do while the sergeant was killing your son?

turns.speaker: HATE COUNSELOR
turns.text: You can't say that....

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: The Nazi's killing his kid. He could've jumped the guy. He could've gouged his eyes out, grabbed the bayonet and gutted him.... What would you have done if they were killing your son?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: SO THEY SHOT HIM! SO HE WAS DEAD. SO WHAT. HE'S WORSE THAN DEAD NOW. HE'S A PIECE OF SHIT...

turns.speaker: HATE COUNSELOR
turns.text: Okay, that's it. You're going back to --

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What do you think you should have done?

turns.speaker: HATE COUNSELOR
turns.text: Where do you think you're going?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: ...We have nothing to learn from these people. They should learn from us.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: It's Friday....

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Do I give a shit?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: The Torah says not to light a fire on the Sabbath, because it's work, correct?  But if alternating current's running through the wires every second of every day, and I throw a switch, send it here instead of there, how is that lighting a fire?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: "Do chickens give milk?"

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Exactly.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Who's this?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Dennis Leary.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Leary?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Howard Stern.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Obviously.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Adam Sandler.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Funny?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Not like Mr. Dorfmann.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: He was funny.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: After your mother died, that's when you stopped going to shul. Doing your homework. Everything.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: And that's when the Mets started to stink.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: 'Cause they got rid of Johnson. He knew how to deal with the assholes. Dallas Green, please...

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Valentine...

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: There's some maple walnut in the freezer.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Linda says you're not supposed to have dairy.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Just a little... What's the difference?

turns.speaker: MRS. MOEBIUS
turns.text: We want you to help run it. Give speeches, lead seminars... Handle the fund-raising.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Fund-raising??

turns.speaker: MRS. MOEBIUS
turns.text: We think you'd be good at it.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I'm not an intellectual.... I mean, I read, but... Fund-raising isn't what I...

turns.speaker: MRS. MOEBIUS
turns.text: Look, if you want to kill Jews on your free time, fine. We need you to raise money. Will you do that for us?

turns.speaker: MRS. MOEBIUS
turns.text: Do you have a suit?  Let's get him one.... And a cell phone too.  And if you insist on blowing up a synagogue, make it that big one on Fifth Avenue, would you?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Beth Shalom? It's Reform.

turns.speaker: MRS. MOEBIUS
turns.text: So what?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: They're not that Jewish.

turns.speaker: MRS. MOEBIUS
turns.text: I don't care what they are. I know those people, and I don't like them. The rest are just a bunch of kikes, aren't they?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: We tested the new bomb.

turns.speaker: MRS. MOEBIUS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: We redesigned the timing mechanism. It can't possibly malfunction.

turns.speaker: MRS. MOEBIUS
turns.text: Danny, please. Just give your speech.... And nothing about Jews, okay?

turns.speaker: MRS. MOEBIUS
turns.text: Are you out of your mind?!

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I was just trying to make a point. If --

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Do you think I...

turns.speaker: MRS. MOEBIUS
turns.text: Danny, please, we don't want to know.

turns.speaker: RABBI
turns.text: May He cause the light of His countenance to shine upon you and be gracious unto you....

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Eat shit....

turns.speaker: RABBI
turns.text: ...May you be blessed in your going forth as you were in your coming....

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: EAT SHIT, ASSHOLES....

turns.speaker: RABBI
turns.text: And let us say...

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Oh, fuck you...

turns.speaker: RABBI
turns.text: As you know, Cindy, thirteen is a mystical number in the Jewish faith. We believe that God has thirteen attributes...

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: ...You're saying that when he first appeared at your house, you had no idea he was Jewish....

turns.speaker: MRS. MOEBIUS
turns.text: None whatsoever. But I have to admit, I'm not terribly surprised.

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: MRS. MOEBIUS
turns.text: I think anti-semitism today is largely a Jewish phenomenon. Wouldn't you agree?

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: In the Third Reich, weren't a number of high-ranking Nazis of Jewish origin?

turns.speaker: MRS. MOEBIUS
turns.text: Yes, and they were said to be the most virulent proponents of the Final Solution. Really, who but a Jew would want to kill Ilio Manzetti simply because he was Jewish? Who thinks about such things?

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: The papers are going to report tomorrow that your colleague, Curtis Zampf, has been a federal informant for the past two years. Do you believe that?

turns.speaker: MRS. MOEBIUS
turns.text: Curtis is always more complicated than he seems. Even now.

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: And so, on this, the most solemn day of the Jewish year, a former yeshiva student is being sought in connection with a monstrous hate crime that --

turns.speaker: BONITA
turns.text: You're going to live here permanently?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: ... Maybe, if Jacques will let me fix up the place a little.

turns.speaker: BONITA
turns.text: He's shy, not like Enzo.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Yes.  Not like Enzo.

turns.speaker: BONITA
turns.text: I think, he's really nice... He's a funny guy... sometimes even very moving.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: ... I'm pregnant, Bonita!

turns.speaker: BONITA
turns.text: Are you going to keep it?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BONITA
turns.text: Does he know?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: BONITA
turns.text: Maybe you should talk to him about it.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: I can't... I just don't know how to...

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: I was thinking of something kinda stupid last night.  You know those women in the greek mythology that made love with the Gods.  Take Leda for example, sleeping with Jupiter, who came to earth as a swan... Well, can you imagine Leda announcing to her swan "You're going to be a father, my little chick-a-dee"?

turns.speaker: BONITA
turns.text: But your man isn't quite a God!

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Probably not, but I still don't have the nerve to tell him.

turns.speaker: BONITA
turns.text: Well, you're going to have to tell him, sometime!

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: And you...?  Do you love Enzo?

turns.speaker: BONITA
turns.text: Very much, I think.  But, there's going to be a problem.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: You're leaving?

turns.speaker: BONITA
turns.text: Yes...  Could you please give this to Enzo.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Bonita, you shouldn't be discouraged so easily.

turns.speaker: BONITA
turns.text: I don't have the strength to fight off la Mamma... Anyway who wants to spend their whole life waiting at the end of a pier.

turns.speaker: BONITA
turns.text: Did you tell him?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Not yet... I'm waiting for the right moment.

turns.speaker: BONITA
turns.text: ... You take care of yourself, Johana.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: This is good work... unfortunately it's incomplete.  Could you eat a sandwich 40 floors above the street.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: What kind?

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: Johana, am I boring you?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Sorry.  Of course not, definitely not... well, maybe a little.  What did you say?

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: I said that the file is incomplete.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: Did the driver really freeze?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Like a popsicle.  They're keeping him on a stick until spring.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: My God!  I'm glad I didn't go.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: ... So am I.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Listen, I just found out we've got real problems in Sicily!

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: What d'you mean?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: The mafia!  La Cosa Nostra!

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: What's happened??

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: The documents are forged.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Yes!  The notary is a phony.  He has the same signature as the contractor!

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: It can't be true!

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: We have to send somebody over there immediately!  If we prove the forgery we can cancel the policy. We'll be off the hook.  There's a flight to Rome in two hours and from there its just a short hop to Sicily.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: I'll send Cardoza, he'll be able to...

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: I tried him, he can't go.  His son is being Bar Mitzvohed tomorrow... I'll go, boss.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: I thought it was Spanish that you spoke?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Italian is practically the same thing.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: Good afternoon.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: I came to make a clean breast of everything... the whole business.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: Yes.  Of course.  Very wise.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Remember when I went to Italy and canceled the policy on the new stadium.  Well, we weren't being cheated by the Mafia or anybody except maybe by me...  ... Do they come for lunch everyday? I really went on my own business, to see a man that I happen to be in love with... and I'm glad I did it, but I'm sorry about the policy and I'll be happy to make up the money the company didn't get... of course just now I don't have...  One million, four hundred and ten thousand dollars.  But if you were to dock my salary, say, twenty dollars a week, in a few hundred years we'd be even... and I think this is where you fire me?

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: You're right.  You're fired.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Will that interfere with my getting maternity leave?  I'm pregnant.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: The Italian, I presume?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: No.  He's French, he was just in Italy for the competition.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: He seems to have won it.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Yes, isn't it wonderful?  I'm so happy.  I'll bet I'm the happiest pregnant fired person in the world!

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: I tell you she's mine!

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Hello!

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: You know each other?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Enzo Molinari.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: This is a great pleasure.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Johana Cross, pleased to meet you.  Well!  Isn't this a coincidence. I really wasn't expecting this... All the way out here.  It's incredible!

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: I wish, but it's full.  They recommended a pension in town. They say that all of Taormina is full.  What's going on here?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: It's the Free Diving World Championship.  I am by the way world champion!

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: A spaghetti del mare for the super dedicated traveling insurance agent.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: I think I'll have a coffee.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Where did you two meet?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: In a lake.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: I might have known.  As I was telling you earlier, I'm the world champion free diver.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Congratulations.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Some people say it's the most virile sport in the world.  One has to admit that when you see those men diving head first in that deep blue sea, all muscles contracted in one super human effort...

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: A new world record!  That's great! It gives me something to beat tomorrow!  You ever been to Tahiti?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: I'll take you there.  We'll live in the sun.  You'll cook fresh fish and we'll make love under the coconut trees.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: You forgot the Hula!

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Yes, of course, I'll do the Hula!

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: You'll be lovely, but no thanks.  Jacques, would you do a native dance for me?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: He looks strange, doesn't he? Like a baby that just learned to walk.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Have you known him long?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Forever.  We used to live on the same island in Greece, when we were kids.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: What was he like, when he was little?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Little.  Very little.  And skinny, very skinny too.  That is compared to me.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: I get it, Enzo you were a superior child.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Exactly!  What is it Johana?  You're so crazy about him, you don't see the truth?!

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: And just where are you from?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Italy!

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Huh?  Well listen to him!  Do you hear that?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: He looks me in the eye like some fuckin' gold fish, and says:  "I'm going to beat you".

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: ... That's what he's here for, isn't he?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Listen to her!  "That's what he's here for"!  He's here to loose, that's what he's here for.  First of all, I'm unbeatable.  Second, how old are you?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Tonight we're having a little party among ourselves.  8 o'clock in my suite?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: ... It's easy.  You go down.  You come up.  ... Right, Johana?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Congratulations, Enzo.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Don't you agree, Jacques?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: And the lights!  Running lights, stealing stretchers...!  You'll have us in jail.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Enzo, stop bitching, will you?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Well, good night, then...

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: You going to sleep here, all by yourself?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: ... It's a comfortable place.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Sinister is what I'd call it...! Ours is so much cheerful!  Why don't you come and stay with me... There's plenty of room in my suite.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: The Mamma's there too.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Yes, the Mamma is is there.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Good night Enzo, Good night Jacques.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Is it a poem?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: No, it's the recipe for spaghetti "Frutti del mare".  You see I was right in getting you out here.  You're a world champion, my friend!

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Jacques!  Johana!

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Enzo!

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Okay, now we have a good five minutes to have a nice peaceful talk.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Checking out the competition.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Enzo, why do you guys do this?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: What else is there?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: You know what I'm talking about.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: You risk your life when you cross the street.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Damn it!  Why won't you give me a straight answer, for once?!

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Because you'd laugh.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: I won't, I swear.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: I dive in search of God.  If I go deep enough I'm going to find him.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: A little... You think it's the same for Jacques?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: No.  Jacques is a creature of the sea.  He isn't meant to live on earth, among us... You should know this, Johana.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: He can learn.  He is learning.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: You really think so?  Did you tell him you were pregnant?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: How do you know that?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: You told Bonita, but you didn't tell him, right?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: ... Not yet.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Don't.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Because he won't understand and it will just hurt you... Jacques has been put on earth by complete mistake.  And he's only waiting for one thing:  that some God up there will turn him into a fish! How long has that moron been down there?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Five minutes and fifty seconds.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: That idiot!

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Is he alright?  What happened?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: The fool was asleep!  If I weren't around, he'd already be dead!!! Is that who you want to live with?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: How did it happen?

turns.speaker: SUPERVISOR
turns.text: The company asked me to extract everything I could from the wreck; so the divers were trying to get at the engine... and then the boat turned over... in the current... and... look, I fucked up!  Can you help?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: How many are, down there?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Ten thousand.

turns.speaker: SUPERVISOR
turns.text: Lira?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Dollars.

turns.speaker: SUPERVISOR
turns.text: You're going to hold me up at a time like this?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: In my village, we have a saying: when the wind blows, the flags of all nations flap in the same direction.

turns.speaker: SUPERVISOR
turns.text: What does that mean?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Roberto?  How long?

turns.speaker: ROBERTO
turns.text: Six seconds.

turns.speaker: ROBERTO
turns.text: Enzo, what are you going to do with the money?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Have the car painted.

turns.speaker: ROBERTO
turns.text: Santini will do that for 25 dollars!

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Then tell him to wax it too.

turns.speaker: ROBERTO
turns.text: Enzo, really.  What are you going to get?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: A rosary for Mama, a dress for

turns.speaker: ROBERTO
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Find the Frenchman.  Find me Mayol.

turns.speaker: ROBERTO
turns.text: What about the shoes?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Very chic.  Anyway, you don't have anything else, do you?

turns.speaker: ROBERTO
turns.text: Enzo, wake up!

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Eh?  Si!  Avanti!

turns.speaker: ROBERTO
turns.text: The medics are looking all over for you.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: I'm meditating, can't you see? Jacques does two hours of yoga before going down.  I can take a five minute nap, can't I?

turns.speaker: ROBERTO
turns.text: Where did you get that?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: "That"!  This is not a "that"...

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Is he here?

turns.speaker: ROBERTO
turns.text: He's training.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Plenty of women everywhere right?

turns.speaker: NOIREUTER
turns.text: Smoking is absolutely forbidden.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: It isn't lit yet.

turns.speaker: NOIREUTER
turns.text: You shouldn't even carry cigarettes on board!

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Listen we're not supposed to piss either but that doesn't stop you from carrying "it" on board?!

turns.speaker: NOIREUTER
turns.text: The rules are the rules.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: ... What's your name again?

turns.speaker: NOIREUTER
turns.text: Noireuter.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: And where did you say you were from?

turns.speaker: NOIREUTER
turns.text: I didn't say...  Brussels!

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: What's with the voice?

turns.speaker: NOIREUTER
turns.text: It's nothing.  It's just the helium, because of the air pressure.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: And... does the voice come back?

turns.speaker: NOIREUTER
turns.text: For others, yes... For you, who knows?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Try speaking to me?

turns.speaker: NOIREUTER
turns.text: Is that alcohol?  Are you out of your mind?  Alcohol is strictly forbidden.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Hey!  D'you have any other complaints?  Just make a list and we'll stick it on the porthole! Okay?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Well, if it isn't the little Frenchman!  How is the little Frenchman?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Fine!

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: You don't mind if I go instead, do you?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: If you did mind, you'd tell me, wouldn't you?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Jacques, my friend, how are you?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Enzo...

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: That's good.  You never would have recognized me, huh?  Check out the suit! Looking good, no?  You know I'm the world champion?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Yes, I know.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: I dove 315 feet!

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Great!

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: They say I'm like Lazarus.  You know, the guy who was raised from the dead?!

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Because I'm sure you're dying to beat me.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: I don't want to be in any competition... I dive because I like to, not to beat a record... don't you have to be very mad at somebody to want to beat him?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: No.  All you need is to want to be the best.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: You're the best, Enzo!

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: That's too easy!  Every time I beat a record there's always some dumbshit asking me:  "D'you know that French guy, Mayol?  He's supposed to be very good!  Too bad he doesn't compete." So, you're going to come with me to Taormina! First, because you're my friend and second, because you don't have one reason to keep on spoiling my pleasure.  ... I'll see you there...

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: I remember.  Hi Roberto!

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: What room have you got?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: I don't have one.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: You don't have a room?  Paolo?  What did I just hear?  I personally called you to reserve a room for my good friend Jacques Mayol and you treat him like a stranger?!

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: It's okay, Enzo.  I'll go somewhere else.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Not only is Jacques Mayol a very special friend, but he happens to be one of the best divers in the world!  And you're throwing him out!  Are you crazy, or what? Stupido!

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Enzo drop it, I'll find something.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: ... So, after all these years, you must have lots of questions to ask.  Am I right?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Yes, of course.  Lots of questions.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Well, what are they?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: I'm sorry... I don't know how to ask the questions.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: That's good.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: How do you make a living?  Your experiments, does it pay well?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: It's okay.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: ... You married?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Me neither, 'cause of my Mother. She's a curse, my Mamma, a tornado. Stubborn as a mule!  I was engaged... for a week.  After that, Mamma was so mad, I tell you, pasta was bouncing off the walls.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: So, not married.  Well, good for you.  You play the field, like me. A girl in every port, huh?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Exactly, I mean, after all, we're men!

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Damn right!  That's what I tell them when people say you've turned into a fish.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: People say that?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Forget it.  I was joking.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: No, no!

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Not at all!

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: You're staying at the hotel?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Enzo?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Your mother?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Ahi, ahi, cazzo!  Ma mamia! Where...?  God, she'll kill me...  ... if she catches me eating pasta in a restaurant.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Madame...

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: ... And his friend, Johana...

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: C'mon, you two... Jacques, we have to get ready for the ceremony tonight.  We have a new world champion.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: I'm a little tired, I don't know if...

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Get in the car!

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Then, it's very chic.  Avanti!

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: ... For the mermaids.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Today at lunch, you asked me if I had any questions.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Ah ha.  You finally want to know about women.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Why?  Are they what's most important?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: No... It depends... Sometimes they are... What, exactly do you want to know?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: ... Everything.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Everything about what?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Well... about everything.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: If we don't... I'm going to beat you.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Two years younger than you.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: As I said, second of all you're too skinny.  You've got tiny lungs. I still don't understand how you can dive without getting sick.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: The size of the lungs has nothing to do with it!

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Look at me.  These aren't lungs. These are... Tanks.  How long can you hold your breath?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Tell me, why don't you go and get your medal?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Because pasta should be eaten "Al Dente".  So the trinket will just have to wait a bit.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: No, I have to ask you a favor...  You're the only one who'll understand.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: ... I'm listening.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Hey!  Will you slow down!  When did you learn how to drive?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Driving isn't the problem, it's remembering the right road.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Good night.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: You don't need a stretcher to take her with you.  You know that, don't you?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: The dolphins aren't the only ones who don't feel very good sometimes.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Here...  Here...

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Little presents, nothing much... I knew it, I just knew it!  Look here!

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: You still collect them?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: You don't have that one, do you?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: No.  Thank you.  It's really beautiful.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Oh it's nothing.  I knew it.  I told Roberto "He's very good that little Frenchman, very good".  I lost my title but I won a watch!

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Can I come in?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: No problem, I enjoy talking in my sleep.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: He doesn't like us.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: So what!?  His job is to hand out the paychecks.  And he does that very well, let me tell you.
